original_solution_mapping.L1: The total cost of the four T-shirts is 4 x $20 = $<<4*20=80>>80.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Three pairs of pants cost 3 x $80 = $<<3*80=240>>240.
original_solution_mapping.L3: Two pairs of shoes cost 2 x $150 = $<<2*150=300>>300.
original_solution_mapping.L4: The total amount of all the items is $80 + $240 + $300 = $<<80+240+300=620>>620.
original_solution_mapping.L5: Thus, Eugene will get a discount of 10/100 x $620 = $62. Therefore, Eugene will have to pay $620 - $62 = $<<620-62=558>>558.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 6584.
    Returns: the total amount Eugene has to pay.
    """
    # L1
    num_tshirts = 4 # four T-shirts
    cost_tshirt = 20 # $20 each
    total_cost_tshirts = num_tshirts * cost_tshirt

    # L2
    num_pants = 3 # three pairs of pants
    cost_pants = 80 # $80
    total_cost_pants = num_pants * cost_pants

    # L3
    num_shoes = 2 # two pairs of shoes
    cost_shoes = 150 # $150
    total_cost_shoes = num_shoes * cost_shoes

    # L4
    total_cost_before_discount = total_cost_tshirts + total_cost_pants + total_cost_shoes

    # L5
    discount_percentage = 10 # 10% discount
    discount_divisor = 100 # WK
    discount_amount = (discount_percentage / discount_divisor) * total_cost_before_discount
    final_cost = total_cost_before_discount - discount_amount

    # FA
    answer = final_cost
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The total cost of the four T-shirts is {num_tshirts} x ${cost_tshirt} = $<<{num_tshirts}*{cost_tshirt}={total_cost_tshirts}>>{total_cost_tshirts}.
Three pairs of pants cost {num_pants} x ${cost_pants} = $<<{num_pants}*{cost_pants}={total_cost_pants}>>{total_cost_pants}.
Two pairs of shoes cost {num_shoes} x ${cost_shoes} = $<<{num_shoes}*{cost_shoes}={total_cost_shoes}>>{total_cost_shoes}.

The total amount of all the items is ${total_cost_tshirts} + ${total_cost_pants} + ${total_cost_shoes} = $<<{total_cost_tshirts}+{total_cost_pants}+{total_cost_shoes}={total_cost_before_discount}>>{total_cost_before_discount}.

Thus, Eugene will get a discount of {discount_percentage}/{discount_divisor} x ${total_cost_before_discount} = ${discount_amount}. Therefore, Eugene will have to pay ${total_cost_before_discount} - ${discount_amount} = $<<{total_cost_before_discount}-{discount_amount}={final_cost}>>{final_cost}.
